subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|坴|丮||t2=to hold|ls=ic}} – to plant. 

The {{zh-l|*圥}} in {{zh-l|*坴}}, the left part of the character, was the result of corruption of {{zh-l|*木}}. {{zh-l|*丸}}, the right part of the character, evolved from {{zh-l|*丮|to hold}}. The original character depicted a kneeling person planting a sapling ({{zh-l|*木}}) into the soil ({{zh-l|*土}}). {{lang|zh|埶}} is the original character of {{zh-l|*蓺}} and {{zh-l|*藝}}.

The character {{och-l|埶}} was also often phonetically borrowed to represent another character {{och-l|勢}}.
